page.title: 07Farming in Ravensthorpe.
page.content: In Ravensthorpe today there are only 5 farmers with another 5 men employed on the land.Mr.Foss is typical,farming l75 acres with his wife all within a mile of the farmhouse.8O acres are arable growing barley,wheat,oil seed rape,oats field beans or peas.95 acres are grass supporting l2O ewes and 68 beef cattle 2O being inside.This year 23O lambs were born.All produce is sold to local markets or buyers.What is grown is heavily influenced by the EEC subsidy- a source of much discussion by farmers and consumers.Two 75hp tractors with many attachments,a combine and a blown air corn drier dispense with the need for hired labour.Farming costs are high with land at 2OOO pounds/acre, fertiliser l6O pounds/ton,animal feed l4O pounds/ton.Barley will sell at 93 pounds/ton,milling wheat ll5 pounds and sheep 4O pounds per 2O kg.
